website_summaries.verdict: A budget-friendly option that is practical for older children. Though basic, it also has some excellent features including Alexa that make it a solid deal.
pros: Has impressive features for the price, including high-contrast IPS display, 1.3 GHz quad-core processor, and Alexa
Kid-friendly features including sturdy build and parental controls
cons: Not specifically designed for kids – settings may be too difficult for young children to master
not as speedy or responsive as some of its competitors

website_summaries.verdict: Despite its performance limitations, you'll be hard-pressed to find a better entry-level tablet than the 2017 Amazon Fire 7.
pros: The Amazon Fire 7 is inexpensive, runs Amazon's user-friendly operating system and houses a microSD card slot expandable up to 256GB
This 2017 edition is slightly lighter and battery life has been improved
Amazon Prime members can access the bevy of free TV shows, movies and games included with their $99 (roughly £75) annual subscription
cons: 1,024x600 display is sub-HD quality and not as sharp as the display on the step-up Fire HD 8, which doesn't cost much more
To truly take advantage of what the tablet has to offer, you need an Amazon Prime membership and there's no access to Google Play Store without a hack

Seriously, for $30 just get one!
customer_reviews.author: LGC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price, great back up device.
customer_reviews.text: For a sub $40 tablet, this is a great device. The screen is clear and sharp. Availability of apps is good and OS is solid. It's not for daily use or you will throw it against a wall. However for times when you are not as in a hurry, like killing time on a plane or train, then this device is ideal. It's also a great back up device when traveling in case you loose your primary device.

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver

customer_reviews.title: Best cheap tablet!
customer_reviews.text: There's a a few things about this tablet that make it great. First the price is $30 - $50 depending when you buy it. Second it's very snappy when running Amazon apps and decent when running other stuff. The display isn't great but it is ISP so you get decent viewing angles. And third and not least, it makes for a good book reader due to its pretty insane battery life or can be a tablet for a kid.

customer_reviews.author: Barbara H.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a newer updated tablet. However, this is NOT it. It is geared for one thing only. That is shopping on Amazon. I like shopping on Amazon, but I need the tablet to do more. I like the Alexa feature. Bottom line. I regret buying it.....
customer_reviews.author: E. Alan Poe

customer_reviews.title: Auto-Update Ruined This Device
customer_reviews.text: I had this Fire (7th gen) for just over a year. It was never very fast, but it was adequate for light web browsing, watching videos and reading e-books. Today, it suddenly became very unresponsive and the web browser wouldn't work. The reason why: yesterday it auto-updated to Fire OS 5.6.4.0. This auto-update, WHICH YOU CANNOT TURN OFF, ruined the device. I spent nearly 3 hrs on the phone with Amazon's Tech Support, and it's still barely usable. So, after a year of use, an automatic OS update ruined this device. Of course, there's no way to downgrade it to an earlier OS. That's why this is the last Kindle I'll ever buy.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product

I tried the factory reset, reboot and so far nothing will allow me to even use it ... it’s too late for replacement item but I will Contact Amazon tech support to see if they can help ... others have contacted Amazon support w no success so Not too hopeful ... but read latest reviews before you buy this .

customer_reviews.text: I like the size and the readable screen. The memory is enough for my needs, but it is made better with additional swap-able memory. The programing trades off the hardware's low price for the a invasive format that is aggressively giving you options to buy what Amazon is trying to sale. If not for the low price I wouldn't be affording the tablet, so I consider it a fair trade off if it doesn't get much more aggressive. I really like the the Alexa comparability and the text to speech option for the kindle eBooks. The text to speech option make it possible for me to get great value from my Kendell unlimited eBooks option from the Amazon prime subscription.

customer_reviews.title: be WARY of buying the 7th generation Kindle

I have started noticing the battery is not staying charge as it did in the beginning. So came out on the website looking for answers, a manual maybe and saw all of the negative reviews. boy do I feel ripped off. I was hoping to get a few years use out of it not a few months. will not be replacing as some have. buyer beware I guess.
customer_reviews.author: 4evercountry

customer_reviews.text: Bought the fire 7 as a gift. Directly out of the box it started shutting off randomly. Everything about the item seems great otherwise. This product should be flawless out of the box. Tried chatting with customer service, and after ten minutes the only thing accomplished was the introduction. Finally after being prompted to verify product ID I was disconnected. This has been by far my worst experience with Amazon. I've come to expect five star customer service from you guys.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Bought at sale pricing and it serves it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Fire HD7. The battery on it was quickly dying and when I replaced it the unit would power up with a dark screen. I would have purchased the one with 16 gb of memory if I had to do it over. The operating system and proprietary software takes up a lot of memory and most apps won't save to the sd card. Even after this length of time (almost 2 years) Amazon has not upgraded into the 6.0 and higher version OS. I miss the higher quality screen and stereo music system on the older unit. Also, you are still limited to apps via the Amazon App store.
customer_reviews.author: Highlander

customer_reviews.title: Battery drains in one day.
customer_reviews.text: I went from a fully charged battery to one that was completely dead in less than 24 hours. I attempted to contact Amazon but they are always "to busy" to return a call. customer_reviews.title: Smooth Operation - Sharp Color Screen - Has Web Browser
customer_reviews.text: For the cost this is hard to beat! A bit heavy for regular Kindle Sometimes I fall asleep reading and if I'm on my back it hits me on the nose... I was impressed at how smooth the overall operation was it is a nice color screen for the money and I can use the built-in browser to look up my next book. The battery will last all day. I tried it to run some web based applications I use and thought that seemed pretty sludgy, but overall I am well satisfied with the device.

customer_reviews.text: I've gotten Kindles since they first came out. I have bought probably four Kindles over the years. Loved them. customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have gotten the bigger one

customer_reviews.title: I will be going elsewhere when I purchase my next tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Fire 7 is very slow acting. Takes too long to open any app. Battery drains very fast, and takes a long time to charge. There is no option to clear all cache at once,instead, you have to take the time to go into each app and clear them one at a time. Pathetic No matter what app I'm using the action is jerky not smooth, slow reaction time. Not at all satisfied. My previous 3 no dles, on their worst days were better then this piece of garbage. I would NEVER recomend this tablet to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: connie

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge!
customer_reviews.text: I bought five of the fire tablets for Christmas,by February we were having issues with the charging ports. The only way the tablets will charge if I literally hold the charger in place. Also don't like that you can't download apps from Google play,just the Amazon app store. MY children are very disappointed. I would like a refund as I don't have money to waste. Or please give my children replacement tablets. I would greatly appreciate it as I am a single mother. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have an iPad and MacBooks along with a traditional Kindle reader, which I love. The Kindle is user friendly and the learning curve is as minimal as it gets. I happened to win a Fire tablet and have at's tempted a number of times to use it. It's not user friendly and I waste more time trying to accomplish something. The one star is for the light weight and thinness which fits into my handbags. The screen has a nice sharp image so that's a positive also. But other than that, not much else good to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: SD Lover

customer_reviews.title: downloading library books is a huge hassle
customer_reviews.text: I like to use this to read books from the library while offline, but while occasionally they download quickly & easily, I usually have to go to "manage your content & devices" on the Amazon site, and accessing that page on the kindle is difficult with its tiny icons & slow responses.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Update: Tablet legitimately died one week after this review. Won’t even turn on now. Seriously DO NOT BUY this product or any Amazon brand tablet. Absolutely terrible. If I could give zero stars I would. Legitimately freezes all of the time even if it’s not connected to WiFi, constantly closes apps such as Netflix during the middle of a show/movie. Has zero storage space because you can’t remove the pre downloaded apps, once of which constantly displays adds on your home screen and lock screen. Honestly don’t waste your money on this, my LG tablet from 2014 still works better then this one and half the screen is cracked.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: In terms of value for money you cant beat this. I bought this for two reasons, reading on my commute and letting my son watch movies on planes. If all you want is to consume multimedia then spending multiple hundreds of dollars on a tablet is ridiculous with a tablet like this around. It works well, integrates great with my Amazon purchases and other devices and has a decent battery. Few nit picky complaints. It has no auto-unlock feature because of the special offers, also the screen is cluttered with every Amazon owned app in the world and you cant delete them. Screen smudges easily and does not do well in bright light. But, for the price, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Slow and unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: I was looking forward to getting Kindle Fire after my old one died. I'm disappointed. The device is very slow. I thought it was an internet issue, but all other devices work just fine in different settings with different internet speeds, except this Kindle Fire 7. Most of the time, I have to sit there and wait until a page or an app opens, as if I'm still in 1990s with a dial-up connection. Also, often I click on the screen and nothing opens. It's so frustrating that I honestly don't even want to use this device. I guess it's good for reading books, but then I might have as well gotten the very basic Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: EP

customer_reviews.title: Small but that makes it easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this much since I got it, mostly just pushing apps and playing around. It's obviously much smaller than the 10, which is what I am used to so this will take an adjustment. The keyboard is arranged differently than the 10 and I am hitting the wrong button often to hit "enter." I have no technology of capability complaints and I would recommend this for someone who wants to use this during travel or commuting. It's very compact and will fit in a purse or backpack easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slow... real slow.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my son who was getting interested in our phones. He’s 1 and I thought it would be fine that this was a low end tablet maybe I could load a few games and overall didn’t have high expectation for it. Even with my expectations set low I couldn’t believe how slow it was. My son would lose interest in the game before even starting waiting for it to load up. I got it for Christmas and it’s already lost in the abyss somewhere since nobody wanted to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I should have read reviews before buying.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd fire tablet and I have a kindle reader. I've had it for one month and when it came on after charging, it was so dark you could not make any thing out. If there was a place to rate it lower than one star I would. I had it one day over the time to return for a refund. So I have no choice but to return for exchange. My generation 3 lasted longer but was not eligible for exchange so I simply discarded it. I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER FIRE TABLET. They are slow loading, slow at doing commands and I don't need the fuss in my life.
customer_reviews.author: archas

customer_reviews.title: USB Charging Port Failure
customer_reviews.text: **Be aware of the USB charging port.*** This is my 2nd Fire tablet I purchased for my grandson. Both are now unusable due to not being able to charge the device any longer. The 2nd device is only 3+ months old. The USB charging port begins to fail after a while. When the problem started, we had to arrange the device putting something against the USB cord so it would charge. Now when you plug in the USB cord to charge, it does nothing. This is a wide spread problem as there are posts all over the web and on YouTube. Other than this issue, it is a good little tablet. Charge time is decent.
customer_reviews.author: terdallaujar

customer_reviews.title: After a few months all three I own stopped charging
customer_reviews.text: This seem to be a very nice tablet that is when it works I have 3 and all of them have stopped charging after a few months. Plan to have to purchase a new tablet after about 6 months the charging port gives out on every single tablet. Photo attached. This is the 3rd tablet I have that at simply claims it's charging but does not go past this point.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Disposable tablet
customer_reviews.text: Have had two. Bought both at the $29 prime days price. They last about a year and a half before the battery dies or the sd card fails(yet it's fine on any other device). Main issue I have is the games I have played cannot be transferred over to a new unit as most of the game is stored on the tablet and not on the sd card. Still a decent deal, just don't fall in love with the one in your hands. And the warranty is 1/2 the price of the tablet so that's a hard pass too.
customer_reviews.author: Just another fan.

customer_reviews.title: I love my Fire 7!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet! I bought this on Prime day for $30 and it's so worth the price! I gave it to my mom and she uses it for watching Prime video, watching the local news, Youtube, cooking videos, buying things on Amazon, etc. Easily worth the $30 I spent on it. My only complaint would be the resolution. It's perfect for my mother, she doesn't care if the quality isn't crazy good. However, when I look at the tablet, I immediately notice pixels on the edges of apps and very little detail in the wallpaper. Still overall an amazing purchase for $30!
customer_reviews.author: Tim McArthur

customer_reviews.title: great when it worked
customer_reviews.text: This review is coming alittle late. we bought this in 2017 and for a few months it was awesome, however it died in 2018. first wasn't holding batter life, and eventually just stopped charging all together. my 6 year old found it in a drawer recently, asked if she could use it, for fun i tried a few online tricks to reset this item, it's still dead. she asked if we could get a new one, my answer nope, i'm not gonna though more money down the drain on this brand
customer_reviews.author: smiles

customer_reviews.title: Great durable tablet EXCEPT for one thing....THE CHARGING PORT
customer_reviews.text: LIke the title states this thing has been dropped from everywhere. My kids have beat them up and they survived. Not even a cracked screen! But i do have 7 kindles and only 2 of them work. Only reason both work is because they have the magnetic charging ports. Thats the weak point of this device. The charging port. Our 5 broken kindles ALL had broken charging ports. So if you buy this device, make sure to buy the magnetic USB chargers as well. They will save you lots of headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Tha Scarecro

customer_reviews.title: Too bad..
customer_reviews.text: So far this cheap tablet is a POS as far as I'm concerned. I purchased it because I wanted to download Android apps, but that capability is NOT built in. As near as I can tell, you have to download a bunch of apps from Google. But there is no straightforward description of how to do that. Amazon is usually focused on customer satisfaction, so I'm wondering if this is an example of Google vs. Amazon hostility. I'll keep trying, but if I cannot figure it out by tomorrow, I'll return this tablet. Too bad...
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tablet since April of last year, so just a little over a year now. I can no longer charge (charging port), so its useless. I went online to research this problem and found that this issue is extremely common and has been for quite some time. So yeah, the price my seem reasonable, but if you have to buy a new one every year, ITS A RACKET!!!! After reading the reviews, something I'm ashamed I didn't do before purchasing, I see that, again, this problem is very common, yet Amazon continues to sell them. DO NOT BUY YOUR ELECTRONICS FROM AMAZON!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Katonga Radford

customer_reviews.title: Returned mine, but would still recommend this for others with different needs.
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with the location settings (turned on, but location was not recognized by certain apps), so I returned this item. But otherwise, I was impressed with this tablet! I can definitely see why the Fire tablets are so popular! I use a 2017 iPad every day, so I was expecting the Fire tablet to be terrible by comparison, especially for the price. But it was actually very responsive, easy to use, and felt nice to the touch. If I didn’t want to use apps that require location settings, I would have kept mine- it was probably just a glitch. But for “light” tablet use (for kids, reading books, etc), I would definitely recommend this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: dandeliongirl

customer_reviews.title: Geez
customer_reviews.text: Why is it that I must buy a new one every year? All three that I have bought always have the same issue.......charging and email access failure. Always using the charger that came with the unit. I'm no rookie at this, been into computers since 1971. RAM, ROM, power shells, SD cards...etc., etc., Anybody else having this these issues? Oh, these units were used on an average of twice a week, three hours up time.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur I. Jackson III

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The first Fire 7 Tablet was great, however it was lost. Ordered replacement April 2018, however now my Tablet will not charge, after following instructions from Amazon on line, the tablet it DEAD! Highly disappointed that AMAZON does not have a 800 customer service number to speak to a service technician regarding issues like I am having. Baffled that this problem exists, that the tablet will not take a charge. Amazon must resolve this problem. This would eliminate the frustration of having a device that doe not work! This device is useless to me.U have never encountered this with charging any mobile phone device.
customer_reviews.author: Reaux

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased. This is my first Kindle Fire
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased. This is my first Kindle Fire, after several years with a Paperwhite, which I also enjoyed quite a lot. I can take books, videos, and magazines with me wherever I'm going, check my email, surf the web and do many other things I haven't even tried yet. I sometimes watch a movie while waiting for the laundry to dry, without needing a wifi connection. Versatile and seamless, it's a big step up for me. The only slight flaw is the glare on the viewing screen.My Paperwhite has a non-glare screen, and I'd like to see that feature in future Fire tablets. This is an excellent product. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: James J Cumberland

customer_reviews.title: The Tablet I Originally Was Going To Purchase~And Should Have...
customer_reviews.text: [4 1/2 Stars~Due To Minor Limitations] I Previously Had An Android Tablet That I Purchased In August~But[LOOOONG Story Short]It Lagged~Briefly Freezed Up[For Serveral Seconds At A Time]Among Other Dysfunctions~It Was Practically Unusable~Just Sadly Sat In My Desk For About 2 Out Of The 3 Months I Had It...So I Returned It To BestBuy Received A Refund/Store Credit And Purchased The Amazon Fire 7... And I'm MUCH Happier... Apart From Some Of The Limitations Of The Fire 7~Its Still A Much Better Tablet~ Comparatively Speaking Than The Previous One I Had~And The Fire 6 I Had 2 Years Ago...And At A Splendid Price... Only $29.99 At BestBuys Black Friday Sale...I'm Rather Quite Happy With My Purchase Of This Marvelously Splendid Device...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Special Offer/Ad Removal is a scam
customer_reviews.text: My mom purchased this tablet for my daughter for Christmas. It has been fine as far as a cheap tablet goes - the os isn’t as good as Apple’s iOS, but I expected that for a cheap android tablet. The main reason for the two stars, though, is because of the scam Amazon is running with the inexpensive price. For an additional $15, you can have special offers/ads removed from the device. Fortunately, we haven’t had any issues with our daughter buying anything she shouldn’t, but we went ahead and removed them. In addition to the $15, we were charged a 14% sales tax. What?! We live in Kentucky. Our sales tax is 6%. Get it together Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Useless for Work. Buy an iPad.
customer_reviews.text: I love all of my amazon products, so I was particularly disappointed when this did not live up to my expectations. This is useless for work purposes. I bought it so I wouldn’t have to carry my laptop around at work all the time. I should have just invested in an iPad. Google drive does not work with this product. I can’t even get the app for the paper or record in my city. If you just want to use this as a kindle, it’s fine, but don’t buy it if you are trying to do more than read books.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen McDonough

customer_reviews.title: Runs faster, but dies out quickly.
customer_reviews.text: My mom ordered this for me since my old one was running out of steam (I had it for 5 years, I'm surprised it lasted that long). This new one works like a charm, and I was able to transfer all of my old data and memory from my first. The only problem is that after a week of using it, the battery life has started to run out a little too quickly. I don't know if its from the data transfer from my old tablet or not? Still, its a good tablet. At least it doesn't take over 20 seconds for a movie or episode to load, but let's see how long that'll last.
customer_reviews.author: Fryzilla: King of the Monsters

customer_reviews.title: Not a long life
customer_reviews.text: This tablet doesn't have a very long life to it. I got my first Fire tablet in Feb. 2018. That one lasted until May 2019 when I got this one. I keep it plugged in all the time but the battery isn't charging and I keep getting warning rings. It also says I have low storage even when I have nothing downloaded. Amazon Fire tablets need to be redone to make them last longer than 15 months at a time. This could get expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Clara1

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I keep buying Kindles / Fire Tablets is because it’s the easiest way to get books. It saves me a ton of time signing into Amazon online, navigating the menu, searching for what I want etc, etc. I never use it to actually read them, as I read them on my iPad. I never play games on it because it’s soooooo sloooooow! Most apps on this device are slow. Load up time is ridiculous. I swear, this time around is the last time I waste my money. Do yourself a favor save your money up and buy an iPad!
customer_reviews.author: Candyland

customer_reviews.title: Skip the “special offers” version
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for family members a couple of years ago and was impressed. However, when I ordered on for myself this year. I can only note that it feels cheap in my hands compared to theirs. Also. If you value your sanity, skip the “special offers.” They’re incredibly invasive and every time you put it down you’ll have to go through an annoying little dance to get back to your content. The touchscreen isn’t very sensitive and you’ll be swiping away hours of your life to get through a confusing plethora of ads.
customer_reviews.author: Literary Picks

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet! You will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fire Tablet. I have purchased many tablets for my kids over the years and I can truly say this one is the best. This will definitely be on my list for Christmas for the kids. Everything is so clear, internet is quick. I love the sleep mode. It also has Alexa voice activated. My kids love this feature. The battery life is awesome. It doesn't die quickly like a lot of other tablets. I love the size of it and I can put it in my purse and take it everywhere I go. This is definitely a great product. I highly recommend it. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brownie

customer_reviews.title: Okay tablet
customer_reviews.text: The tablet I received had a cracked screen. The other kept getting extremely hot. I think it is due to the poor packaging. The package itself is just paper like material that you peel the top off of. Other than that, it is pretty OK, you can browse the internet and stream videos well. It has a problem with going blurry in videos though. I think that mine was just faulty probably due to rough shipping as I got it during the holiday season. BUT I would recommend it if you are looking for a cheaper tablet on a budget. I have bought other fire tablets that were perfectly fine although this time around wasnt the best experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slow and terrible amazon device Do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a birthday gift this past year and have been using it for about 7 months. It is a piece of junk. It's so slow, bogged down by terrible amazon apps and you can't disable anything or even delete icons from the home screen. Do NOT waste your money on a kindle fire if you want a tablet for multiple uses. I only use mine for reading since it's so horribly slow. Think Dial up slow. I was really excited to have this but it's more of a nuisance than anything else. Amazon, you need to fix your platform and allow for people to utilize the device efficiently. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Its OK
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when it was on sale for $29.99, and because of all the positive reviews saying that is is better and faster than the previous generation Fire 7 Tablet. I also have the previous generation Fire 7 tablet. To be frankly honest, other than the overall minuscule size difference and the 'sleep', there is really no discernible performance difference. This Fire 7 loads slower than the previous generation Fire 7, and it runs programs agonizingly slower as well, even with an additional 64GB of memory. Needless to say, I went back to using my previous generation Fire 7.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tablets for kiddos!
customer_reviews.text: Threw me off for awhile with the free time update but after playing with it for awhile, it is a great tool. Kids can download apps just for them simply and easy. Easy navigation for them to find there games and apps and to find new ones. Very easy to switch to adult account and change settings as needed. My only issue is the small storage space and not all apps will go to sd card. But I will soon be upgrading to a bigger internal storage fire tablet. These are perfect for little ones! Even my three year old can navigate this with ease!
customer_reviews.author: tim hughes jr

customer_reviews.title: Stopped charging!
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice tablet but I wish Google play store could work on it. I can't get the apps my baby loves. Update= Stopped charging today... what a waste! It has been hardly 3 months and can't be returned or get any service to sort the issue! Will never buy it ever...
customer_reviews.author: M.Orakzai

customer_reviews.title: Issues with not being able to charge it are common
customer_reviews.text: You can find plenty of reports of not being able to charge the Fire 7. Both my oldest son and I had the same issue. We could not reset and it appears to be an issue with the USB port coming detached from the circuit board. I watched a video where the technician said he had seen this several times. We really liked the device but I had to give it only two stars because we didn't even have these devices for a year when this happened. I hope they did a better job with the soldering on the 10.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Loss

customer_reviews.title: Complete Junk--Battery Issues
customer_reviews.text: We bought all 3 of our kids (Ages 10, 8, & 5) these for Christmas 2017. In short order we all realized how bad the battery life is. A fully charged Kindle can sit overnight off the charger and be completely dead. Unless you leave it on a charger when not in use, it will not be ready to do anything. My kids have opted to do other things and I have $100+ worth of Kindle junk laying around the house. My oldest would rather use an old iPhone 5 than use the brand new Kindle. Sad...
customer_reviews.author: Will Davis

customer_reviews.title: It's a good basic tablet.
customer_reviews.text: So the Amazon user interface is kinda brilliant. gotta give them that. everything Amazon related is order in a super convenient matter, and it makes so much sense it's intuitive to use. However, there's very few apps in the appstore, which is very disappointing. firstly, there's hardly any google app for it. no gmail, maps, hangouts etc. even other apps like Telegram, not to mention more specific apps, are not there. Which makes the use of it very limited. if Amazon wants to compete with a decent tablet they'll have to work on it. everything else, works great!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Froze within an hour
customer_reviews.text: My son used it only about an hour and it's froze. It's been frozen for 22 hrs and it's still on. Bad thing is about these if you have a problem you just can't order a replacement without calling and going thru all the bs of push this button, now try this etc. I don't wanna go thru all that when it's brand new just send me a new one and not some refurbished crap! I got a good price on it so I can't even order a new one without paying more. His previous tablet did last 2 years without an issue so I don't know what the issue is with this one.
customer_reviews.author: mama again

customer_reviews.title: Pay full price for a fungible item (ebook) and cannot share it with a member of your household.
customer_reviews.text: Big brother will not allow you to store personal videos on sd card unless taken by the same kindle fire. This is reader that you cannot share a book with a member of your household with unless you pass them the reader. I really don't like the idea that you pay full price for a book and cannot share it with your wife who uses a Samsung tablet. Some of the game apps from Amazon are good. Don't expect apps from any where else to function properly. Is getting bombarded with ads worth saving $20?
customer_reviews.author: Growit

customer_reviews.title: Good device for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've seen a lot of tablets, I work as a tech who helps people with their devices. I never owned a tablet before purchasing a Fire 7. If you want to spend $300 to $1000, you know the tablets you can buy. From my experience, the only decent alternative is a Fire. The Fire has decent response, it does what it's supposed to do, no it's not a $1k tablet. So far the only thing I have not been able to do is create Google doc and sheets, I assume I need a keyboard. All in all, I'm happy so far, I'm scheduled to give a class on ebooks this summer.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: My device lasted 5 months. It stopped turning on and I attempted to call Amazon support three times and was hung up on twice. I purchased an extended warranty through Square Trade and they won't cover me until the manufacturer warranty is up after a year. Amazon rep. Told me it was 90 days and that I was just out of luck, then hung up on me. Thanks for terrible customer service, amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Renée

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much what you expect for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works ok, kind of slow moving and of course lacking on the space. I see that adding your own storage card is an option so I will give that a try. I’m very used to Apple products but $30 (Black Friday deal) vs. $300 doesn’t really give you much of a choice.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Smith

customer_reviews.title: It is junk, even for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these now. Both broken. Don't waste the money. The second one only lasted about two weeks, and the charging port is messed up. It was hard to plug in right out of the packaging, but it brokecompleyely about two weeks after purchase with regular charging and is now on a shelf collecting dust, just like the other one. The parental controls are crazy, you cannot set parental controls for a kid without setting them for yourself on your profile. You cannot download apps that are not on Amazon without a huge fight, just please buy a different tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Morris

customer_reviews.title: It does what it has to, but...
customer_reviews.text: It is so slow as to be unusable for anything but reading books. Surfing, email, etc, - be prepared to wait. It also seems to turn itself on, so even when I have turned it off it comes back and makes various noises. Next to my bed. At night. I knew there would be limitations on an inexpensive device like this. I bought to access service that my local public library provides that are not accessible via Kindle. It's OK for that - magazines, etc. - but not much else.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Glazer

customer_reviews.title: Okay Kindle
customer_reviews.text: I have a Fire 7" Tablet but it is getting old so I ordered a new one. I found it very good for reading books but when I wanted to watch a movie or TV show I couldn't get the volume up loud enough to hear comfortably. I turned it by the screen volume and went into the setting volume. I turned both as high as I could and could barely hear it. It was my 4th or 5 Kindle so I do like them but this one seemed to have a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No access to Amazon unless you have WiFi.
customer_reviews.text: We, my wife and I, have older Kindles that we used in our travel to Central and South America and had no problems ordering books while there. Recently we both purchased Kindle Fires. Our Internet went out in our marina, we live on a boat, and we can't order any books to read because we have no Internet. There is no mention of this, what we feel, is a major flaw in the Kindle Fire. We can get a signal in South America or on our boat, but but not in the USA with the new Fire??? Please correct this.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for $50 but very slow
customer_reviews.text: Considering it was $49.99 I guess this tablet is doing the best it can. I got it for games and for my kids when we travel by plane. The operating system is very slow and crashes at times. The kid friendly options are fantastic but the slow operating system can be torture when dealing with an impatient 2 year old. Even writing this review I had to use my iPhone because it would be too slow and painful to do on the fire. Having said that, for $50 this is perfect to use to entertain the kids when stuck on a plane. If it weren't so slow it would be perfect as it does almost everything an iPad can.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Slater

customer_reviews.title: Great deal on a good tablet but size does matter and this one is a bit small and low on memory (see review for my memory tip).
customer_reviews.text: It's a great tablet and I bought it at a great price, but you need to take into account that minimal storage and tiny screen. I solved the storage issue with a 128gb SD card (buy the Sandisk Ultra 128GB Micro - it's great and Amazon often has it on sale) and now I have more space than I know what to do with. But the small screen is smaller than I thought, and it does make some tasks a little less enjoyable. It's not Amazon's fault, of course. I made the decision to buy this size to save a few bucks. I regret it and next time I'll go for a few more inches.
customer_reviews.author: barg

customer_reviews.title: okay for a kid tablet, I would not use one for myself
customer_reviews.text: it's okay.... not great. I don't like the speed,it's slow. and I don't like that blocking things from my child in the free time app is extremely inefficient and takes forever. i don'tlike like that she can just download games inside the free time... she sees something she likes and touches it, it begins to download.... why? I like all the time restrictions and adding safe websites on a list. I don't like that i can't just add a youtube playlist link..... it wants me to add videos individually. it's okay for a kid tablet, I would not use one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Berlynn Mech
